title: Letter: COP27 must be made aware of plastic solutions
text:
The Global Plastics Policy Centre was launched at last year's COP26 to help find sustainable solutions to tackle plastic pollution. However, with companies like Coca-Cola continuing to increase production of virgin plastics, this solution seems to be slipping further away from fruition (Report, November 3).

At COP27, governments must crack down on plastic usage. However, they must also discuss funding sustainable biopolymer research.

Many bioplastics are still derived from materials that can't fully degrade in normal conditions and damage the environment when not disposed of correctly. If we are to find a solution to plastic pollution, we must then fund the organisations' developing materials that can degrade naturally without industrial catalysts.

The science is already there, with many new materials achieving biodegradability certification following robust OECD 310 testing. The question is, will it be relayed to world leaders at COP27?

Duncan Clark
Teysha Technologies
London EC2, UK
